intro: Willoughbya micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willoughbya, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Australia. It is a member of the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Willoughbya micrantha is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions.
